A combination of 3 dice becomes a "secret move", unique and unstoppable for each character.

A "plume" die allows to control luck and take advantage over your opponents.

88602.name: Ultra Coliseum DX: Ultra Senshi Daishuketsu
88602.description:
User Summary

Ultra Coliseum DX: Ultra Senshi Daishuketsu is a fighting game released for the Wii. The game is based on the family of Ultraman television series. The game lets players control one of the main characters from the Ultraman franchise and face off in combat against a series of enemies. Playable characters include Ultraman Zero and Ultraman Belial, as well as a number of Ultramen from the different series up to the "Ultra Galaxy Legend" movie.

88603.name: King's Bounty: Crossworlds: Game of the Year Edition
88603.description:
User Summary

King's Bounty: Crossworlds Game of the Year edition is a compilation release for the Crossworlds expansion. The bundle includes all of the new features brought to the game by King's Bounty: Crossworlds, as well as the original King's Bounty: Armored Princess game.

88604.name: King's Bounty: Platinum Edition
88604.description:
User Summary

King's Bounty: Platinum edition is a compilation title released alongside the launch of the King's Bounty: Crossworlds expansion. The bundle includes the base game - King's Bounty: Armored Princess, as well as the addition content added by King's Bounty: Crossworlds. The Platinum edition bundle also includes the original King's Bounty: The Legend.

88605.name: Tilting Dice
88605.description:
Tilting dice
by James Ryan

Tilting dice is a two-player abstract strategy game designed for use with Nestortiles. Players construct a modular board and then strategically position their dice to make a capture. When two dice connect, the die with the highest facing side wins.

SET UP:

1) The board:
Each player picks two colors of Nestortiles and takes all the tiles of those colors. The rest of the tiles are shuffled face down and patched together into a 6x6 grid. The grid is flipped over, revealing the pattern of pips. This will be used as the game board.

2) The dice:
Players now use their twelve Nestortiles to assemble two dice in any way they please.

3) Placing the dice on the board:
Players now place their dice in the corners of their own side of the game board with any side face up, so long as it does not match the number of the tile the die is on. Who ever is start player should place his or her dice first, giving the second player a chance to evaluate the position and place his or her dice accordingly.

Example: In one of Eva's corners, there is a tile with four pips. She may place either of her dice in this corner, so long as it is not showing 4 pips on its top face. Once she places both of her dice, it will be Nestor's turn to place his. Then Eva will make the first move.

Players may decide turn order in any manner they like. Start player will alternate each round.

OBJECTIVE:
The first player to "capture" one of the other player's dice wins the round. First player to win 3 rounds wins the game.

GAMEPLAY

1) Moving dice:
When players take their turns, they move one of their dice three times. Moving a die means "tilting" it on to the next space forward, backward, left, or right, so that the top face of the die becomes the side facing that direction.

Example: Eva will play first. She decides to move her die that shows a green 5 on top. First, she will move it one space forward. Eva now tilts the die forward so that the green 5 faces forward and the die rests squarely on the next tile forward.

Now this same die shows a blue 2 on top and she wants to move this one space to the left. She tilts the die to the left so that the blue 2 is now the side facing left and the die lands squarely on the next tile to the left..

Now this die has a blue 5 on top, and Eva wants to move it one more space forward, so she tilts the die forward, moving the die onto the next tile forward so that his blue 5 faces forward, toward her opponent. Eva's turn is turn is now over.

At no point during a player's turn may they move their die back onto a tile it has already touched during the same turn. This means players cannot retrace their path or repeat moves during the same turn.

Dice may not be moved diagonally. Dice may not be rotated.

2) Making a capture:
When two opposing dice are in adjacent squares, their facing sides are compared. The die with the highest value on its facing side captures the other and the round is over.

Example: One of Nestor's dice shows a 4 on one side. Eva is able to move her die so that it ends on the space adjacent to this side with a value of 5 facing Nestor's 4. Eva's 5 beats Nestor's 4, so Eva wins the round.

Dice cannot be captured "in passing." In other words, the sides of dice are not compared for a capture unless a player has completed all three moves of his or her turn. If dice are in adjacent squares on the first or second move of a turn, there is no comparison of sides and no capture.

Sometimes, a die will end a turn on a "matching" tile. A die is said to be on a matching tile when its top face is of the same value as the tile. When a die is on a matching tile, all of its outward facing sides double in value for as long as the die remains on the matching tile. This means it may capture a die showing a side of greater value than it would normally be able to capture.

Example: One of Eva's dice is on a matching space, and its outward facing sides show values of 2, 3, 4, and 4. Because she is on a matching tile, their values are now 4, 6, 8, and 8. As soon as she moves off the tile, their values will return to normal.

Let's say Eva ended her turn on a matching tile that is adjacent to one of Nestor's dice. His die shows a 6 facing hers, and her die shows a 4 facing his. Ordinarily Eva would lose the round in this position, but because she is on a matching tile, the value of her 4 doubles to an 8. Her 8 beats Nestor's 6 and she wins the round.

If dice are compared for capture and their values are equal, no capture takes place on that turn.

STARTING A NEW ROUND

Once a capture has been made, players collect their dice and prepare for a new round. Players should decide before a game begins whether or not they want the ability to remake their dice between rounds. Unless otherwise stated, dice should retain their composition for the duration of the game, and the board should likewise remain intact for all 3-5 rounds.

The game ends when a player has won three rounds and is declared the winner.

88606.name: Primeval Groves
88606.description:
Primeval Groves: The Wanderers Guild Guide to Dangerous & Unusual Plantlife

From the back of the book:
The bounty of life surrounds us all and yet most of you will never see the true beauty and horror that the mother earth has given us.

From the usefulness of the Goodberry plant and the Gub Nut to the seething hatred running through the sap of the Pine Brethren mother earth can be a most temperamental bed fellow. Traveling from the deepest darkest woodlands and across the most treacherous of seas I have traveled with my companion, young Matron Grubb, so as to enlighten and warn you all with a selection of shoots, roots and legumes to behold, befuddle and ... b e w a r e.

From the Journals of Gubin Turnipheed

This tome, the third in a series of guidebooks by the legendary Wanderers Guild, is a collection of essays and expositions by the renowned Gubbin Turnipheed. Gubbin has noted down his findings over the years of his exploration across the known, and some unknown lands, with his "companion" young Matron Grubb etching what he finds in his on "special" style. Here you will find detailed narrative and remarkable depictions of the creatures and races, herbs and useful plants, peoples and gods that Gubbin has encountered on his travels.

Matron's etchings have been converted to a more distinguishable style by Guild Illuminator Scott Purdy and Gubins' original manuscripts translated by master scribe Andrew Troman. This d20 system source book has been brought together to ensure those traveling across the wilds are equipped with the knowledge that not all that is green is edible. Some of it may well be doing the eating.

88607.name: NBA  Ballers
videogamehonor: 2004 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2005 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2005 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
88607.description:
NBA Ballers is a streetball game which is similar to AND 1 Streetball and gameplay similar to the NBA Jam series. The game features fictional NBA analyst Bob Benson (voiced and depicted by Terry Abler) and MC Supernatural doing the commentary. Supernatural makes many references to the Mortal Kombat series and NFL Blitz two games published by Midway. The game also maintains the "player on fire" feature that is in many, if not all sports games published by Midway. Most of the moves that were in the game were from real street ballers who provided some of their moves for the game. The game is powered by Gamespy game technology.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nba ballers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88608.name: Cranium Cards
88608.description:
The card game that gives everyone a chance to shine! Get ready to act, draw, describe and spell backwards in this exciting, laugh-out-loud card game where you supply the answers. You never know what you'll do next with Cranium Cards!

(back of the box)

Contents: 80 cards, timer and instructions. You need to supply pencil and paper

To Play: This is a great game to play in teams. One team draws an orange card and secretly comes up with an answer "e.g something that makes people laugh" and places it face down.
The performer for the other team looks at the answer without showing anybody and then turns over the top purple card which shows the activty and how many points for guessing the answer.
There are 5 possible activities: Cameo - acting out the answer, Cloodle- drawing the answer, Listofacto - describe it by using no more than 3 facts, Grilleps - spelling it backwards and Choose it - you get to pick which activty you want. Lots of fun and laughter!
If you are successful, keep the purple card and the points - you've earned it! Then the other team has a turn. Play until all the purple cards are used, tally the points and the winner is the team with the most points.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Australian Game Nominee
2011/2012 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Australian Game Nominee
88609.name: Higher or Lower
88609.description:
Q: What is the average weight of an adult male blue whale (to the nearest tonne)?

How many people would know the answer to this question... not many you may say! But there's always some 'smarty pants' with a photographic memory for this type of information.

And how many games have you played where the person in the lead just moves further ahead... and wins. There's no excitement in that! "Higher-or-Lower" is different. It allows anyone to play... 'smarty pants' or not... and everyone has an equal chance of getting the answer right... even if you don't have the faintest idea of what it is!

"Higher-or-Lower" combines the fun of learning, with a playing board where players can be blocked from moving. "Chance" questions can boost you higher... while those annoying "Group" questions can see you slide lower.

Add to this the delight of the last person (to depart the bottom row) collecting and placing those 'land mine' like yellow "Group" disc's anywhere on the board at anytime, and "Higher-or-Lower" offers a riot of fun and entertainment to all!

(from the back of the box)

88610.description:
Axel,der Erneuerer is the 2010 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

This card was given out by Klaus Teuber at the SPIEL10 in Essen.

It´s limited and was only available at the SPIEL10.

Ability of the card:

Reißen Sie ein Gebäude ab. Ersetzen Sie es durch ein anderes Gebäude und zahlen Sie soviel Gold, wie das neue Gebäude mehr kostet als das abgerissene. Baubedingung beachten!
88610.name: The Rivals for Catan: Axel the Innovator
boardgamefamily: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan

88611.name: My Little Restaurant
88611.description:
My Little Restaurant is a click'n'drag restaurant simulation. You've never run a restaurant? No worries, it's really simple and loads of fun. With simple, yet challenging gameplay, additinal minigames and many customization options, it's a must-play for all Nintendo DSiWare users and iPhone owners!

Source: The Game Website.

88612.name: My Little Restaurant: Christmas Edition
88612.description:
User Summary

A Christmas-themed version of their My Little Restaurant. In the game, you are a waiter in a restaurant, attempting to get as many tips as possible. You must seat all the guests, take their orders, bring them their food, and clean up after them - and do it as quickly as possible, because the faster you are, the more money you get to take home.

88613.name: Airport Madness Challenge
88613.description:
Have you got what it takes to manage a busy airport? See if you can take the position of an air traffic controller at six challenging airports.

Push yourself to move traffic as tightly as possible without compromising safety or incurring delays. Challenge your friends in a multiplayer showdown. Work at a tropical location.

Have you ever wanted to be an air traffic controller? This is your opportunity to see if you have nerves of steel and a clear head!

If you have tried Airport Madness Mobile, you must try Airport Madness Challenge. In each exciting level, traffic and complexity gradually builds until all but the finest controllers wash out. Sink or swim!

Source: The Developer Website.

88614.name: Trade Nations
88614.description:
Take your Nation from a fledgling village to a bustling economy in Trade Nations! Harvest raw resources, refine them, and create goods to amass a fortune. With over 14 jobs for your villagers to perform, and over 60 buildings to create, there's endless possibilities for your Nation.
Are you ready for Greatness?

Source: The Publisher Website.

88616.description:
From the back of the game box

Who will be the hero of snowy slopes? Who will hit the most targets and reach the finish line first? Will it be a Bear, a Wolf or a Fox?

Biathlon is a fast-paced, educative and extremely fun board game which will keep all family members occupied. A perfect game for long winter evenings!

Compete with other players in cross-country skiing; your speed increases with every successfully memorized card and there are other equally interesting disciplines such as howling and hooting which will make you laugh!

You will love Biathlon because it motivates you to act and think fast; Rules can be adapted for all age groups; This game encourages children to improve their visual memory; Biathlon guarantees hours of fun for all family members.
88616.name: Biatlon

88617.name: Goroth: Slave of the Empire
88617.description:
from the back of the book

"Four thousand years ago, Goroth was a beautiful trade world. Caught between two warring factions that covered its resources, Goroth was too difficult to occupy, yet too valuable to remain free. The solution was destruction: after 'The Scouring', Goroth was forever changed into a wasteland.

Now, the native Gorothites are begining to rebuild their civilization, but the horrors of the past have come to haunt the present.

Yet again the world is caught between two warring factions: the Empire and the Rebel Alliance.

Yet again the world is too valuable to remain free: rich deposits of hyperbarides have brought the galaxy's megacorporations.

Will Goroth suffer the same fate a second time?"

88618.name: Le Secret du Tombeau
88618.description:
User Summary

A previously undiscovered temple lies in the middle of the jungle. After a perilous trek, you stand at the entrance, ready to explore the depth of the temple or die trying.

Le Secret du Tombeau ("secret of the tomb") is a top down arcade-adventure game. The player leads an explorer in the ruins of a temple, collecting useful items and trying to escape the many hazards in the game. There are numerous traps and enemies (snakes, mummies...). Some enemies can be destroyed using the appropriate item. Each special feature of the temple (like water pools or levers) has a descriptive text, often including clues.

The game includes 3 different endings.

88619.description:
Gummy Bear Factory is a card game designed by BGG user ralpher and his wife, Saya Tsong. Gummy Bear Factory is a Euro-style filler card game with elements inspired by great card games such as Bohnanza, Lost Cities, and Great Wall of China.

Description from TheGamecrafter.com:

Life as a worker in a Gummy Bear Factory is tough! Not only do you have to make each gummy bear by hand, you have to watch out that your sneaky coworkers don't try to build off your labors and take credit for your work!

Gummy Bear Factory is a fast-paced card game of trading and set collection for 1-5 players, playable from ages 8 and up.

The game uses unique cards composed of heads, middles or legs gummy bears in different colors. On your turn, you take or trade for gummy bear parts and try to lay down complete gummy bears of three matching cards. Players build new gummy bears or onto existing gummy bears. The game is won by the player who created the most gummy bears and scores the most bonus points for having majority control on a row. The game is easy to learn, but it takes strategy and cunning to win.

The game is inspired from European boardgame design. It emphasizes easy to teach rules, no player elimination, no language, and game mechanics that emphasize strategy and paying attention to the gameplay rather than completely luck.

Gummy Bear Factory is the only game that you can use real gummy bears in place of the included scoring winks and increase your fun! You provide your own. Symbols allow easy play for color blind players. There's also a challenging solitaire variant and special two player rules.
88619.name: Gummy Bear Factory

88620.name: Super Match 3
88620.description:
Super match 3 is a super addictive puzzle game that breaks the mold by allowing players “freedom of movement”. Challenge yourself and match the pearls together, feel the adrenaline in surviving mode and take the ultimate test in endless mode.

Super match 3 logo

Features:
-3 Dynamic match all
-3 Match all
-3 Endless match
-3 Bomb survival
-3 Score vs time
-4 Multiplayer levels
-6 Challenges

Source: The Developer Website.

88621.name: Les Templiers d'Orven
88621.description:
User Summary

As newly dubbed Orven templars, your group of adventurers must explore 4 different dungeons and destroy the evil creatures dwelling there.

Les Templiers d'Orven is a party-based role-playing game. The player creates a team of up to seven characters, buys equipment and chooses one of the four dungeons to explore.

The game interface is heavily inspired by Wizardry: a small window displaying the current location in wireframe 3d, a list of possible actions and a summary of the party members statistics. Character creation is semi-random, each character has a random starting score in each stat, which the player can improve by expanding points in one of the several available skills. The final character stats determine the character's class (guide, scribe, warrior or templar). Defeating monsters give experience points, necessary for levelling up, and gold pieces, useful for buying better equipment. Casting spells costs Concentration points, regained by resting or drinking potions. One of the spells allow the player to take control of one the opponents and add him to the party. Similarly, some monsters can take control of party members.

One of the interesting features of the game is the possibility, while exploring a dungeon, to encounter and fight one of the player's previous adventuring parties converted to Evil.

88624.name: Rival Magic
88624.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Order of Hermes is supreme, unchallenged in its mastery of magic. All other magicians are hedge wizards ... maybe interesting to researchers, but certainly no threat. Or so magi of the Order tell each other. And most of them actually believe it.

The four traditions in this book prove the folly of that complacency:


The Amazons, female warrior wizards beyond the borders of Europe, harbor a deep hatred of the Order for reasons that no magus could ever guess.
The Augustan Brotherhood serves as court wizards, supporting its political ends with mundane force as much as with magic discovered in the tomb of Virgil.
In the icy north, the Muspelli plot to release their jotun masters and destroy the world in frost and fire.
And in the the distant east, the powerful Soqotran sorcerers dwell quietly on their island, staying out of politics and looking nervously at the expansionist Order.


How long can the Order of Hermes maintain its pleasant illusion of superiority?

88626.name: Unistuste Agentuur
88626.description:
From the rules:

Game is based on a TV show here in Estonia called "Unistuste Agnetuur" ("Dream Agency").
In it a story telling game in which each player must make a dream party for the customer.
In each turn one player is a customer and all other players are dream party makers.
Before customer takes a card from a theme deck, each player takes 1 card from 4 card piles (not the theme deck). On each of those card are 1 word. Now, the customer says the theme and each player now must put together a party idea for the customer using those 4 cards in their hand.
After which, customer will decide who had the best idea and went close to what he / she wanted.
Game goes on until everyone has been a customer.

You win the game if you have collected the most theme cards while making the best parties. If two or more players have equal number of cards, then they must count flowers on them. Each flower is a point and a level of difficulty (1-easy, 3 hard).

88627.name: SWAT 4:  The Stetchkov Syndicate
88627.description:
An expansion pack for SWAT 4 was released on February 28, 2006 in North America. The expansion includes seven new missions featuring the fictional Stetchkov crime family.

VoIP capability has been added to multiplayer games, there are seven new missions, two new multiplayer modes, seven new weapons, players may strike suspects or hostages with their weapon to prompt compliance, which has the same effect as a non-lethal weapon, suspects will now pick up their weapons if they are not swiftly arrested, 10 player co-op with up to two teams of five, stat tracking, ladders and rankings for multiplayer, orders can be held in single player until the leader gives the go command and an option to have only one person issue commands and lead the team.

Source: Wikipedia, "SWAT 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88628.name: MGT
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88628.description:
User Summary

MGT ("Magnetik Tank") is an arcade-adventure game in which the player leads an hovercraft in an isometric 3d maze, looking for the central brain controlling a subterranean complex.

Each room of the game is a different puzzle. Some enemies must be destroyed, others avoided, some doors can be opened by shooting at them or at a symbol in another room... There are also different kinds of blocks, with different properties (some can be destroyed, some move up and down when shot, others invert the controls...), and special floor tiles which allow the hovercraft to fly in order to reach a higher door. The player must also take the hovercraft's inertia into account, and watch for the timer.

88629.name: Ärihai
88629.description:
From the rules:

Game idea is to rise your firms stock times 20 it was at the beginning of the game.
Each player gets one firm at the beginning of the game and starts to develop it step-by-step by moving from the developers track to the wall street track and from there to the win.
During the game you do a lot of selling and buying, going through business schools and paying fines to other companies.
The whole game is a cross-breed from Monopoly and Cashflow.

You win the game when you have raised the stock value 20 times.

88630.name: Card Wars
88630.description:
Played with a standard deck of playing cards.

2-player rules:
One player takes all the red cards; the other black cards.
Jokers or the card box are laid to form the central tile of a 5x5 grid. Players each lay a card orthogonally adjacent to this central tile.

Then players take turns either:
- laying any card in an empty space orthogonally adjacent to an existing friendly card.
- laying any card on top of a friendly card (to increase defence).
- laying a card on top of an enemy card. This can only be done if the enemy card is orthogonally adjacent to a friendly card AND the card being laid is higher in rank than the existing card.

The winner is the one to occupy more spaces.

3 player game:
Players 1 and 2 take a suit each. Player 3 takes 2 suits, giving them stronger card to make up for being wedged in the middle.

4 player game:
Each player uses one suit.

88631.name: Doppel-Grübel
88631.description:
This game is very similar to Memory, but it is an educational game. The pairs consist of a tile with a picture and a tile with the matching word. Whether a picture and a word belong together can be checked by a code at the side of the tiles. As in Memory, the players try collect tile pairs until the playing area is cleared; the player with the highest stack at the end of the game is the winner.

Several editions have been announced by the publisher; as of Essen 2010, only the one about musical instruments seems to be available.

88632.name: Down in Flames: Guns Blazing – Extra Decks
88632.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The card decks contained in the Down In Flames - Guns Blazing game will accommodate up to 6 players. However, if you want to play monster air battles, this is the item for you!

This is functionally an expansion as it ups the number of players in the game from six to twelve.

88633.name: Raon
88633.description:
Raon means fun by traditional Korean. This game can be viewed as a Rummikub like game using Hangul(Korean alphabet) tiles instead of numbers. Two rules, basic and speed, are provided in the manual. The following describes the basic rule.

Each player initially gets 15(13 for 4 players) consonant tiles and 5 vowel tiles and then tries by turn to form a Korean word using his/her tiles. After the mandatory first time registration of 3 or more syllable word, each player's word can contain any number of syllables. Also each player can re-use any tiles from the previous player's word and return not used tiles to the draw pile; therefore there is at most only one formed word all the time. If a player cannot form a word, he/she can exchange any number of tiles with draw tiles and end his/her turn. The first player to use all his/her hand tiles wins the game(or round, using scoring variants).

Components:
56 plastic consonant tiles (square)
24 plastic vowel tiles (long)
4 paper covers
50 cards for speed game
1 manual (Korean and English)

88634.name: Dead to Rights II
88634.description:
A reputable judge uncovers a citywide crime syndicate, and is kidnapped. The judge was a friend of Jack's father, so the cop is obligated to send a few hundred men to their graves in order to make things right. Before long, all hell breaks loose, so Jack and his K-9 cohort Shadow must take on a powerful mob in the fight of their lives to break the city’s spiral of betrayal and corruption. In the end, the judge is murdered and although Jack gets the killer, goons of a high-ranking Russian crime lord named Blanchov get the judge's files. Jack's girlfriend Ruby is murdered by Blanchov and although Jack never retrieves the files (they were likely Hennesey's files from the first game), he goes after Blanchov for revenge. Jack kills Blanchov, but gets no satisfaction out of it knowing that Blanchov is just a highly placed puppet that can easily be replaced. Having lost Ruby, Jack has nothing to really live for anymore. Also he claims that whoever is responsible has him Dead to Rights as they got the files and he ended up with nothing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dead to Rights II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88636.name: kill.switch
88636.description:
Kill Switch (stylized as kill.switch) is a video game developed by Namco in 2003 for the PlayStation 2, Xbox, and PC. A Game Boy Advance adaptation was released in 2004. The GBA game was created independently of Namco, due to a licensing deal with Destination Software. As a relatively straightforward third-person shooter, the most distinguishing characteristic of Kill Switch is a mechanic that has the player character taking cover behind objects and around corners in a manner similar to Time Crisis and Winback.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kill.switch", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88637.name: Time Bomb
88637.description:
Publisher blurb:

World War III is over -- a nuclear holocaust begun when the Republic of Turrannia detonated a suitcase bomb in an American city, in retaliation for the assassination of their President.

Two years after the bombs, a super-scientist has developed a rudimentary time machine. There's enough power for a single window to open for a few minutes. A few of the world's remaining heroes (along with a villain or two) volunteer to go back in time and prevent the apocalypse by eliminating the superhero who assassinated the Turrannian President.

Unfortunately, that superhero is one of the Player Characters.

Time Bomb is an M&M Superlink adventure for three to five heroes of 10th level, in a standard four-color campaign setting. The adventure is designed to plug into any setting, featuring modular notes on tailoring the adventure for insertion into your own campaigns.

Requires the Mutants & Masterminds RPG, Second Edition,by Green Ronin Publishing For Use. Mutants & Masterminds, M&M Superlink,the M&M Superlink logo,and Green Ronin are trademarks of Green Ronin Publishing and are used with permission.

88638.name: Outlaw Volleyball: Red Hot
88638.description:
A version of Outlaw Volleyball released by Hypnotix and video rental chain Blockbuster as an exclusive. The game's setting is in Hell with the only court being The Pit of Hell.

Source: Wikipedia, "Outlaw Volleyball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88639.name: Dragon Island
88639.description:
Publisher blurb:

A world-renowned daredevil and adventurer organizes an expedition to a lost island in the South Indian Ocean. Rumors speak of the island being home to a fabulous treasure...a tribe of bloodthirsty savages....and a dragon, worshipped as a god!

Dragon Island is an adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Walt Ciechanowski, this 30-page adventure is intended for a group of 3 to 5 players of 5th through 8th level.

88640.name: Lost Temple of the Incan Blood God
88640.description:
Publisher blurb:

An archaeologist and his beautiful daughter have disappeared while searching for Incan ruins in Ecuador. The PCs soon find themselves embroiled in the machinations of a cult seeking to summon the Incan god Tehuacitzal and bring about the end of the world!

Lost Temple of the Incan Blood God is an adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Ken Melvoin-Berg, this 25-page adventure is intended for a group of 3 to 5 players of 8th level.

88641.name: The Mind Murders
88641.description:
Publisher blurb:

Two baffling murders rock the city. Both victims were members of the powerful Marciano mob, but in each case, the murderer was a random citizen with no connections to the victim or the criminal word -- a random citizen who immediately kills himself after the deed is done.

What could be the motive behind these murders? Who is turning the innocent into cold-blooded killers? Can anything stop the Mind Murders?

The Mind Murders is an adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Walt Ciechanowski, this 30-page adventure is intended for a group of 1 to 3 player-characters of 3rd through 5th level.

88642.name: Nazis
88642.description:
Publisher blurb:

The ultimate pulp villains have come to Modern D20!

Perhaps no other group makes as perfect a villain for pulp RPG campaigns as the Nazis. They are the embodiment of evil, and suited for any adventure, whether it is a straightforward tale of espionage or a far-fetched story of occult powers and super-science.

This 30-page PDF is the complete guide to using the Third Reich in your pulp-genre D20 games. It includes:

* The Rise of the Nazis: A historical overview of the creation of the Third Reich.
* Nazi Weapons and Vehicles: The weapons and equipment of the Third Reich, in Modern D20 statistics.
* Nazi Archetypes: Completely-statted NPCs representing the most common Nazi villains of the pulps, including soldiers, officers, Mad Scientists, and the dreaded Nazi Temptress!
* Nazi Plot Ideas: A thorough discussion of adventure ideas using the Third Reich as villains, ranging from the realistic to the fantastic.

88643.name: Rocket Raiders
88643.description:
Publisher blurb:

A crime spree carried out by acrobatic thieves propelled by rocket packs! Museum thefts! Prison breaks! Can the player characters discover the power behind the Rocket Raiders?

Rocket Raiders is an adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Walt Ciechanowski, this 24-page adventure is intended for a group of 1 to 3 player-characters of 8th through 10th level. Rocket Raiders is written for larger-than-life pulp heroes. Suitable Thrilling Tales advanced classes include the Man of Mystery, the Paragon, the G-Man, the Gumshoe or the Ace Reporter. With a little work on the part of the GM, almost any basic or advanced class can be accommodated.

88644.name: Spears of the Tisangani (Thrilling Tales Version)
88644.description:
Publisher blurb:

When they learn that the lost half of an antique map has been discovered, Our Heroes must journey into the heart of darkest Africa in search of the long-lost city of Tisangani! But they'd best beware, for one of their enemies seeks to thwart their efforts to find the fabled city. And if they do reach it, they'll find themselves plunged into a political battle between the king and his warlord, with the fate of all of Africa perhaps hanging in the balance....

Spears Of The Tisangani is the first of Adamant Entertainment's d20 conversions of Pulp Hero adventures from Hero Games.

Written by Steven S. Long, with D20 conversion by Steven Rushing, this 17-page adventure is intended for a group of 3 to 5 player-characters of 7th through 9th level. Suitable Thrilling Tales advanced classes include the Big Game Hunter, the Fortune Hunter, the Paragon, and the Noble Savage. With a little work on the part of the GM, almost any basic or advanced class can be accommodated

88645.name: The Steel Legion
88645.description:
Publisher blurb:

A series of devastating attacks are carried out by giant robots wielding advanced technology! Who is behind the machinations of the Steel Legion?

The Steel Legion is an adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Walt Ciechanowski, this 32-page adventure is intended for a group of 1 to 3 player-characters of 7th through 9th level. The Steel Legion is written for larger-than-life pulp heroes. Suitable Thrilling Tales advanced classes include the Air Ace, the Mad Scientist, the Man of Mystery, the Paragon, and the Rocket Ranger. Suitable d20 Modern advanced classes include the Soldier, Martial Artist, Gunslinger, Daredevil, Field Scientist, and Techie. With a little work on the part of the GM, almost any basic or advanced class can be accommodated.

88646.name: Suddenly... Encounters
88646.description:
Publisher blurb:

THRILLING TALES: Suddenly...Encounters!, written by Shannon Kalvar, presents a series of short THRILLING TALES encounters that can be dropped into any pulp-genre adventure to spice things up! Each entry contains details of the encounter, a discussion of how characters might interact with it, and an array of elements you can introduce to further complicate the situation. You can use the supplement to jump-start a stalled situation, or as a jumping-off point for an entirely new adventure!

Contained within this product are the following pulp encounters:

* Suddenly...The Door Bursts In! -- based on the old adage by pulp author Raymond Chandler: "When in doubt, have a man come through a door with a gun in his hand."
* Suddenly...He Falls!--An informant suddenly falls to ground, dead by unseen means!
* Suddenly...He Pulls a Knife!--The characters come under attack from an unexpected source!
* Suddenly...The Bell Rings!--A damsel in distress arrives on the character's doorstep...is she all that she appears to be?
* Suddenly...The Roof Falls In!--A mysterious explosion turns a routine questioning into a fight for survival!

88647.name: The Mummy's Revenge
88647.description:
Publisher blurb:

A prominent archeologist is found murdered and the mummy he recently brought back from Egypt has disappeared from the Metropolitan Museum in New York City. The PCs are called in to solve the murder and find the missing mummy!

The Mummy's Revenge is the first adventure for Adamant Entertainment's Thrilling Tales line of pulp products for modern D20.

Written by Jeb Boyt (author of the Mesmerist Advanced Class for Thrilling Tales), this 20-page adventure is intended for a group of 3rd - 5th level heroes, and features details so that it can be played as either a puzzling murder mystery, or a spine-tingling tale of supernatural suspense!

88649.name: Ko Shogi
88649.description: Kō shōgi is a large-board variant of shogi, or Japanese chess. The game dates back to the turn of the 18th century and is based on xiangqi and go as well as shogi. Credit for its invention has been given to Confucian scholar Ogyū Sorai. Unlike standard shogi, pieces may not be dropped back into play after being captured. Promotion rules are complex, and the fates of several pieces are interdependent. The objective is to capture the opponent's commanding pieces: The general, plus the governor if present, or either the banner or middle army if not. Two players, Black and White, play on a go board ruled into a grid of 19 ranks (rows) by 19 files (columns) with a total of 361 intersections. Each player has a set of 90 pieces of 34 different types. The pieces are round and flattened like go stones. In all, the players must remember 65 different moves. The pieces are generally of the same size, though black pieces may be slightly larger than white pieces. Each piece has its name in the form of one or two Japanese characters marked on its face, in white on black stones and in black on white stones. On the reverse side of most pieces are other characters in red; this side is turned up to indicate that the piece has been promoted during play. - Wiki (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ko_shogi)

88650.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Oct/Nov 2003)
rpgissuearticle: On the Dreadful Curses of Blood
88650.description:
From intro to issue:

In this issue, we have the premiere of two regular columns: Uncharted Shores, which describes legendary locations in depth, and All Hands, which provides a detailed NPC for use in your campaigns. In addition, our features in this issue include a complete random adventure generation system, rules for Blood Curses and Crossroads Deals, a Pirate’s Glossary, and advanced rules for ships.

88651.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Feb 2004)
88651.description:
From the intro:

This issue features an adventure, more legendary islands, more NPCs, an expansion of the Afflictions rules, and Encounter Tables for both sea and
port encounters.

88652.name: Two Crude Dudes
88652.description:
User Summary

Two Crude Dudes is an action title for the Sega Mega Drive system. The game takes place in the year 20XX and pits players against the sinister “Big Valley” organization. A series of nuclear explosions have decimated New York City and transformed its inhabitants into dangerous mutants. An evil scientist, through the “Big Valley” organization, is conducting experiments on these mutants and trying to make an army of minions out of them. Two operatives have been hired to enter New York City and stop the scientist’s diabolical plan.

Players control one of two super-powered mercenaries (codenamed “Crude Dudes”) in their mission into the city to defeat the scientist. The characters are extremely powerful physically, and are able to pick up cars and other objects to use as weapons or projectiles. It is even possible to use the other player as a weapon by picking him up and throwing him at the enemy. Each level is crawling with enemies that players must defeat with punch and kick combos. Players can restore health by punching “Power Cola” machines which drop soda can pickups when struck.

There are a range of enemies, including werewolves, skeletons, and hunchbacks. Each level is capped with a boss fight.

88653.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 3 - 2004)
rpgissuearticle: An Expanded Timeline of the Golden Age of Piracy
88653.description:
User summary:

This third issue of Buccaneers & Bokor marks the transition to a quarterly format.

user comment
articles will be added

88654.name: Uchi Mata
videogameversion: UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88654.description:
User Summary

Uchi Mata is a Judo simulation for one or two players.

Gameplay consists of moving towards the opponent, and once the player is in a good position, trying to execute the appropriate movement (or combination of movements) to beat the opponent. Almost all the known Judo moves are present in the game (including illegal ones). The player must also monitor the strength and stamina bars, and sometimes must back off in order to regain energy.

The game was developed with the help of Brian Jacks, a British Judo Olympic champion.

88655.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 4 - Winter 2005)
88655.description:
From the intro:

We’ve got a grand haul for you this issue, mates. Brethren of the Coast Rory MacLeod and Corey Reid have provided us with some sparkly baubles--no less than 2 adventures, an encounter, plus supporting articles as well.

88656.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 5 - Fall 2005)
rpgissuearticle: A Maritime Miscellany: A Dozen Nautical Magic Items
A Widow A Necklace and a Skeleton Key
88656.description:
From the intro:

In this issue, we’ve got the second installment of the Governor’s Prize adventure series, a system for generating NPC Contacts, an article on Rum & Drunkeness, a list of a dozen magical items, and more.

88657.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 6 - Summer 2006)
rpgissuearticle: Never Make a Deal with a Pirate
The Beast of the Middle Passage
88657.description:
From the intro:

In this issue, we not only have the long-promised guide to the settlements along the Spanish Main, and the next installment of the "Governor’s Prize" adventure series -- but we also have not one, but two cursed ships, and a
guide to using the Knights Templar in your piratical campaigns!

88658.name: Buccaneers & Bokor (Volume 1, Issue 7 - Winter 2006)
88658.description:
From the intro:

In this issue, we have the long-awaited final installment
of the "Governor’s Prize" adventure series, a new prestige
class, and an article on running nautical fantasy campaigns.
Enjoy!

88659.name: The Golden Idol of Sikrál (Thrilling Tales Version)
88659.description:
When the review of a dead professor’s papers reveals wrongdoing, the PCs find themselves chasing his unscrupulous nephew to Central America and into a long-lost valley where an ancient civilization unknown to modern man still lives. There they must explore -- and survive -- the temple of the frog-god Síkrál to prove themselves the true friends of the tribe and ensure that the professor’s legacy is not exploited and destroyed.

The Golden Idol of Síkrál is the latest of Adamant Entertainment's conversions of the acclaimed Pulp Hero adventures from Hero Games. Written by Steven S. Long, this adventure has been converted for use with any d20-based pulp campaign...and, along with all Thrilling Tales adventures in 2008, has been dual-statted for use with the FATE-based SPIRIT OF THE CENTURY rules system!

88660.name: The Villainomicon! (M&M 2E Version)
88660.description:
Publisher blurb:

Villains are crucial to superheroes. They don't just provide antagonism -- they demonstrate exactly what it is that makes the hero a hero.

The Villainomicon gives you 20 dastardly supervillains, ready to use in your M&M campaign!

88661.name: Express Raider
88661.description:
User Summary

Express Raider is a two-stage action title originally released in arcades, and later ported to the ZX Spectrum and Commodore 64. The game has the player attempt to rob a train as a bandit in the Wild West.

The first segment of each stage has the player board the train while the battle the banker and avoid coyotes. Once on the train, the player moves from car to car avoiding hazards, including shovelfuls of coal, bottles, and bullets. They battle with enemies on each car, and if they reach the train engine the player obtains the loot and moves onto the second segment of the level.

After getting the loot, the player rides off on a horse and must shoot enemies that appear in the train carriage windows. A woman will appear occasionally, and if the player shoots her they lose a life. Completing the shooting sequence restarts the level with a harder difficulty.

88662.name: Mach 3
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88662.description:
User Summary

Your lover Gwendolyn is dying, cursed by the evil wizard Sfax. You must fly to the Red planet and confront Sfax, for only by killing the sorcerer can the curse be lifted.

Mach 3 is a pseudo-3d shoot'em up. The player controls a space fighter (seen from behind) and battles hordes of enemy aircrafts, dodging meteor showers and trying to destroy ground targets to regain fuel. The player can try to fly under arches to increase her score, but must look out for magnetic mines. Once in a while a heavily fortified bunker appears, it's the entrance to the sorcerer's domain. If the player manages to get in, she must then confront one of Sfax's incarnations.

88663.name: Le Mystère de Kikekankoi
88663.description:
User Summary

"Le Mystere De Kikekankoi" is a text adventure game. You have received a message from a mysterious woman asking you to rescue her from her captor. You drive 500 kilometres to the place she mentioned. Now you stand before the entrance of a cave, ready to solve the mystery or die trying.

This is a text adventure that was first published for Oric Atmos computers. This version has updated graphics, but it remains a text game, with a text interpreter knowing 140 words according to the manual. The player must enter the cave and resolve puzzles to reach the mysterious woman and free her. There are lots of ways to die and the game doesn't have a save feature (it was later republished with a modification allowing to save to a floppy disk but the implementation was buggy).

88664.description:
The game consists of 40 cat puzzle pieces and 40 hat puzzle pieces. Players draw 4 cats and race to find their 4 matching hats. A round ends when one person completes their 4 pairs.

In subsequent rounds, each player draws a new set of 4 cats and play continues until there aren't enough cats left for everyone to have four. The player with the most matches wins.

{user summary}
88664.name: 40 Hats for 40 Cats

88665.description: The Exclusive Warehouse 23 Munchkin Booster is pretty much described by the name: a fixed set of cards for the various Munchkin games sold exclusively through publisher Steve Jackson Games' retail outlet, a.k.a. Warehouse 23. A booster was released annually between 2010 and 2014, and in 2016 Steve Jackson Games re-released all of the standard-sized Munchkin cards from those boosters as Munchkin Hidden Treasures.
88665.name: Exclusive Warehouse 23 Munchkin Booster

88666.name: Axe in Face: Defense of the Daffodils
88666.description:
Even though Red Beard loves gardening more than he loves pillaging, his obsession with flowers can turn him into a vicious killing machine. Not only does he know how to handle a watering can, he can also throw an axe like no other Viking in the village.

* Behead thousands of enemies with a deadly, hurling and ultra-sharp axe
* Beautifully animated cartoon graphics (with blood, of course)
* Easy to learn, line-drawing gameplay
* 32 increasingly difficult levels
* 13 awesome trophies to get your bloody hands on
* Use godly powers to FREEZE and ZAP your enemies to keep them out of the flowerbed

Source: The Game Website.

88667.name: Fun with Death
88667.description:
Fun with Death is an easy-to-learn puzzle game that puts an entirely new spin on the catapult genre. It combines outstanding graphics, level customization and physics-based Rube-Goldberg like mayhem in 60 unique levels. Ready to have Fun with Death?

The bad souls (red guys) are a motley group of former Wall Street bankers, mob kingpins and politicians and it's your job to dispose of all of them in a given level. Earn points and more halos by keeping the good souls (blue guys) intact. Those red guys definitely have it coming, now go out there and do your job!

Saving souls ain't easy, but you're not alone. You'll have three Imps - Heavy, Shield and Sticky - at your disposal. These critters are the ammo you throw in each map, and each one has a unique function. Heavy is good at breaking stuff, Shield forms a protective shield around a soul, allowing them to be used as physics objects and Sticky attaches to surfaces and explodes. The controls are simple, intuitive and fun!

The key to success is to use the wide-range of powerful level objects in a given map and link together hilarious chain reactions that wipe out your targets. A hammer will send steel balls flying. Cogs will channel objects into a given area. Conveyor belts will deposit souls into pits. There are a variety of ways of completing each map, but you'll earn more halos by using as many of these tools as possible

Customization is key! At the start of each round, you add objects - such as sticks of dynamite, ramps and steel balls - into the map that will dramatically alter the outcome. Place them into the map and then go for broke! You'll earn more points for placing fewer objects, so finding that right balance of placed objects and skilled throws will pave the way for a destructive victory!

Source: The Game Website.

88668.name: Garfield: Caught in the Act
88668.description:
User Summary

In Garfield: Caught in the act, Garfield is scared by Odie while he is watching television. He breaks the television by accident which prompts them to repair it before Jon notices. Unfortunately, they don't know what they are doing and end up creating an electronic monster called The Glitch. The Glitch then transports Garfield into the television, where he must travel through a number of television eras to defeat the monster and escape.

88670.name: geoFighter - Light Wars
88670.description:
The galaxy of light is under attack by an evil force. General geo wants to crush you with his geometrical minions. Evil squares, triangles, crosses. Surely you cannot let them have their way!. This is why you’re sitting in your best fighter vehicle, with both thumbs on the controls. It’s your job to save the galaxy or die trying. Your ship is fitted with the most advanced weapons that your civilization developed. If all else fails, you’ve got terrifying bombs that can wipe out everything in their path.

Source: The Developer Website.

88671.name: Necromancer: Rise of the Undead
88671.description:
Necromantic acolytes are dueling in a deserted graveyard to become the most powerful Necromancer! This is achieved by collecting arcane tomes of power & the chest of ultimate secrets, or by destroying your enemies minions with devastating spells and hordes of undead monsters.

This game has been taken to several war gaming conventions in the uK where it achieved Best Participation game at Warfare (Reading 2010)

The games consists of 4 players each representing a Necromancer in charge of an undead horde. To begin with eaxh player has 3 ghouls, these are; fast, good at searching but weak in combat. During each turn the players will raise a skeleton and a zombie to supplement their force. So more figures will enter play as the game progresses. The turn order is determined randomly by pulling stones from a bag. There are six stones, one for each player and the other two represent the resurrection of skeleton & zombie. When a players stone is drawn, they are allowed to move all their figures. No diagonal movement is allowed, nor are you allowed to enter a space occupied by other players pieces, and finally there's a stcking limit of 4 figures per area. After moving any figures against to an enemy must fight (this is compulsory), otherwise they may search for artifacts. Specially prepared dice are used for both searching & combat. These dice have the following faces; 2 x swords, 1 x shield, 2 x eye and 1 x swirl. During searching a number of dice are rolled, if any show the 'eye' the item has been found and will need to be carried back to the Necromancer in order to be used or scored. In combat, both players roll their respective dice, lokking for swords or shields. Basically a shield will negate a sword, any any excess swords on either side will kill a minion each. Spells can be played to influence the outcome of a battle ie 'Battle rage' - All swirls count as swords, thereby increasing your chance of killing your opponents figures.

zombies are slow, not good in searching but the best fighters, skeletons are average across the board. The Necromancer himself, is very good at searching, but otherwise similar to a skeleton.Points are awarded for kills and for collecting items. The first player to acquire 25 points wins. Sets of gems are worth more than singles, scrolls give you another spell but are not worth any points, relics are worth 2 points, the chest is 4 (this is placed in the centre of the board) and potions are worth 1 but can be used in combat to roll an extra die. Kills are worth 2 points each, however the Necromancer is immortal so each wound he takes is worth 2.

88672.name: Iron bottom & Sunset sky
88672.description:
A cardgame for 2 players which simulates battle of Savo island in 1942-43. Designed by Tomoki Kondoh.
Each player gets ship cards and aircrafts cards and must get VPs from eliminating enemy forces or getting enemy bases.
Moderate complexity and takes about 60 minutes.

88674.name: SubWar 2050
88674.description:
From the manual introduction:

"SubWar 2050 is a unique simulation.It combines elements of submarine warfare, flight simulation and strategy games, set in a realistic future world scenario.

You take the part of one of the new breed of submariners, piloting the latest in marine technology; the fighter sub. Working for huge corporations as an independent mercenary, each mission you carry out is rewarded in hard cash.

One moment, you are battling using tactics derived from air warfare. The next, you are diving deep to reduce cavitation and coming to a halt to reduce your passive sonar signature.

Varied missions in four theatres of war, simulated combat mode and a full complement of training missions make SubWar 2050 the definitive underwater combat simulation."

The Campaigns cover:
North Pacific: Training
Antarctica: The Hot Cold War
North Atlantic: The Treasure Trove
South China Sea: Trouble in Paradise
North Pacific/Sea of Japan: Small Islands, Big Business

Copyright is protected by Manual lookup - each time the game is started, a question has to be answered by reading it from the manual.

88675.name: Johnny Reb
88675.description:
User Summary

Johnny Reb is a strategy game concerning American Civil war.

Playable in either 2 players via hotseat or 1 player vs. computer.

88676.name: Pokémon XD: Gale of Darkness
88676.description:
On The Box


Experience The Extra Dimension!

Using Shadow Pokémon, an evil organization has unleashed a sinister plot of world domination. With Eevee as your companion, and with the help of numerous friends along the way, you must fight against terrible foes and race against time to snag and purify the Shadow Pokémon and save the world!


Unravel the mystery of Shadow Lugia

Engage in fantastic battles with your friends! By connecting with a Game Boy Advance - using a Nintendo GameCube Game Boy Advance cable - you can import and battle with your GBA Pokémon from Pokémon Ruby, Sapphire, FireRed, LeafGreen and Emerald!

88677.name: Sakura Taisen 5 ~So Long, My Love~
videogamehonor: 1996 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
88677.description:
The Publisher Website

Sakura Wars is a Strategy RPG that features a unique sim-based story system. An in-depth storyline exists, much like in any other RPG; however, the player’s destiny in the game is not predetermined. Character interaction plays a major role, and your responses to the various characters in the game can ultimately change the story content and even the final outcome.

The battle system is divided into two main parts; ground combat and air combat. Ground combat takes place using two-legged mechanized suits, which transform into jet fighters to take the fight to the sky. Every mech unit in the game can transform from battle mech mode to jet fighter mode during combat. Once transformed, weapons and movement methods will change as well. For example, the hero’s ground mode utilizes a sword as his main weapon, but in jet mode he will use long-range missiles.


On The Box

The stars of Broadway battle against evil warlords of ancient Japan in New York in their steam-powered battle suits, spearheaded by a Japanese youth burning with the spirit of the samurai!

Individual credits:
Oji Horii: Director
Kohei Tanaka: Music
Kosuke Fujishima: Character design

88678.name: Johnny Reb II
videogamehonor: 1986 Golden Joystick Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
88678.description:
User Summary

Johnny Reb 2 is a sequel to C64 strategy of the same name concerning American Civil war.

Playable with either 1 or 2 players and featuring sligthy improved graphic elements over first part.

88679.name: Battle Isle
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
88679.description:
User Summary
Battle Isle is hex based strategy war game similar to History Line 1914-1918.

Main plot evolves around Skynet Titan supercomputer trying to take over the plant of Chromor and Drullish survivors (the player) trying to defend it.
It has a relatively light learning curve due to the fact that new units are introduced throughout the campaign.
Game features light logistic component as well - you can occupy and use a number of supply, repair and manufacture buildings which lets you reinforce your army. It is important because units are able to collect experience points and thus improve their fighting potency.

It can be played either vs. AI or vs. human opponent as well (hot seat).

88680.name: Warhammer: Battle for Atluma
88680.description:
On The Box

Based on Sabertooth Games collectable [sic] card game set in the Warhammer world, Warhammer: Battle for Atluma delivers a unique card game experience on the PSP system! Battle your way through the armies of the Grand Alliance of the evil Hordes of Darkness. Use all your wits and strategy to beat your opponent to the ultimate goal, the Atluma Crystal.

88681.name: Battle Isle 2
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
88681.description:
User Summary
Battle Isle 2 is hex based strategy war game similar to History Line 1914-1918 and its predecessor Battle Isle.

People who played Battle Isle will have no trouble of adapting to Battle Isle 2.
It features similar gameplay, learning curve with improved graphics and number of units.
While gameplay is similar, it has undergone one significant change - move and attack phase are merged together.
Difficulty increases as player advance through campaign; that reflects in opening battle positions - relative number of your and Skynet Titan number of forces.

It can be played either vs. AI or vs. human opponent as well (hot seat).

88682.name: Battle Isle 93 - The Moon of Chromos
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
88682.description:
User Summary

Battle Isle 93 is very similar to its predecessor, Battle Isle, with slightly updated graphics and interface elements.

Gameplay is still the same - Drullian Survivors vs. Skynet Titan.
Some new units and a new story are introduced to the game as well.

88684.name: Constructor
88684.description:
User Summary
Constructor is a building game with a twist. Here you can wreak havoc at your opponent yard and you won't be punished. Well, not until he wreaks havoc at your yard!
General concept is similar to all building and management sims: build a buildings, find tenants, receive money, rinse and repeat.

Graphics are slightly cartoonish and it superbly reflects not-so-serious nature of the game.

88685.name: Luminous Arc
88685.description:
On The Box


Protect the Light, Condemn the Dark!

A Millenium of peace is about to be torn asunder by the spread of darkness. A war with the Witches 1,000 years ago nearly destroyed the planet, and now they have returned. Character designs by Kaito Shibano, music from Yasunori Mitsuda, and solid storylines combine to give tactical RPG fans the kind of portable gaming experience they've been craving!

88686.name: Horror Zombies from the Crypt
88686.description:
User Summary
Horror Zombies from the Crypt is a light left-right scroll arcade horror game.
Plot is built around our main protagonist, Count Valdemar, who happens to be the mansion's owner battling out invading horror entities.

Execution is standard for games of that time: collecting keys, weapons, special items with addition of some new mechanics (eg. sneaking behind monsters).

Game features VGA graphics and runs fine in DOSBox.

88688.name: Sudoku Mania
88688.description:
From the back of the box


The Puzzle Sensation That's Sweeping the Nation!

Enhance your critical thinking skills with the addictive puzzle sensation, Sudoku! No matter what your age or skill level, Sudokumania will challenge your mind everywhere you go!


Endless Gameplay! Auto-generating algorithm allows for an infinite number of puzzles!
Touch Screen Control! Solve your puzzles faster and more accurately!
2 Player Versus Mode! Challenge your friends in a unique game of Sudoku!
Customizable Gameplay! Switch between numbers or symbols or change the difficulty to adjust to your personal skill level!

88689.name: Maracaibo
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88689.description:
User Summary

Your diving expedition in the gulf of Maracaibo has gone wrong. Your friend is trapped in a cage with, his oxygen reserve is low, and you're under attack by sharks, other divers and bombarded with depth charges. You must find the key to the cage before your friend runs out of oxygen.

Maracaibo is a side-view arcade-exploration game. The player must explore screen after screen of sea bed in search of items like oxygen bottles (which can be brought back to the trapped diver to increase his oxygen level), a knife (needed to fight enemy divers and sharks) and the key to the cage. There are several hazards to dodge, like depth charges and falling rocks. The game interface includes a display of the oxygen level of the prisoner and a radar indicating nearby foes.

88691.name: The Game of Life: Adventures Card Game
88691.description:
The Game of Life: Adventures Card Game is a card game following the same classic-remake series as Monopoly Deal Card Game and Sorry! Revenge Card Game, but is different from The Game of Life: Card Game in 2002. This game is simple and quick for families. Cards are divided into four decks by category. You collect points by displaying cards in front of you. Each turn you must play/discard one card and refill hand. Game ends when six out of eight 10-year cards are drawn.

[Box Back]
Your life really is in your hands. Make your Life Story bigger and better than your opponents' with Adventure, Career, Family and Wealth cards.

Always wanted to swim with dolphins? Now's your chance! How about becoming a jet pilot? Do it! Every new experience means more points, and more points means victory!

It's your Life Story - make it a big deal!

88692.name: Foot
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88692.description:
User Summary

A soccer simulation by Loriciels.

Players can play against each other (one with the joystick, the other with the keyboard) or against the computer. There are four teams available (France, UK, Germany, Italy), and each team's players can be customized by distributing points.

The game doesn't implement all of the soccer rules, and there are only five players per team.

videogame: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear
88693.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear: Urban Operations
videogameexpansion: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear
videogamecompilation: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear
88693.description:
Rainbow Six: Covert Ops, is a stand-alone expansion pack of Rogue Spear. The training simulator was developed by Magic Lantern Playware, six of the levels were done by Zombie Studios and three of the levels were done by Red Storm Entertainment. It was published by Red Storm Entertainment. It was released on September 28, 2000. It included nine new missions, because the product was primarily developed as an educational program on real life counter-terrorism history and tactics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rogue Spear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88694.name: Obsidian Twilight
88694.description:
Publisher blurb:

A dark star fell from the sky bringing with it the end of all things!

The sanctity of the world known as Abaddon was shattered when a global apocalyptic event of a meteor impacting the planet causing a destructive ecological and eldritch change. Now there is no day or night, just never ending twilight. An undead world ruled by fear and horror. Undead nightmares prowl the darkest forest with malevolent ghouls, grim demonic fiends and horrific vampires prey on a fearful populace. The world is dominated by the monstrously powerful immortal vampiric lich lord known as Calix Sabinus reigns supreme over this world. And with all this the mysterious force known as Nightwall. Evil dominates the world to be challenged by noble heroes fighting to take back a world that should belong to them. Are you willing to take up the fight?

Inside this book you will find you’ll need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of Obsidian Twilight:

* 8 new races usable as player characters or NPCs.
* Over 100 new feats, over 140 new spells and 6 new prestige classes.
* New monsters and monster template.
* Highly detailed regions and history, new organizations to launch your campaign

Players assume the roles of brave adventures facing ultimate evil in the hopes of saving the world, all in a postapocalyptic setting of survival horror and adventure.

88695.name: Titan Class Scout
88695.description:
Publisher blurb:

Each volume in the Advanced Fleet Designs series features a single starship design, complete with 1" scale tiles of the entire ship. A full description of the ship's history and design is included, and this PDF is systemless so you can use it with ANY sci-fi RPG you play.

88696.name: Mata Hari
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88696.description:
User Summary

Mata Hari is a spy. Her new mission, enter the enemy embassy and free her fellow secret service agent Walls.

Mata Hari is a side-scrolling arcade-adventure. The goal is to reach the room where agent Walls is imprisoned. The player must search for the floppy disk allowing access to elevators, blow up safes with dynamite sticks, shoot guards, evade security systems and threaten embassy personnel in order to collect security doors access codes.

If Mata Hari is shot, she wakes up in a hospital and must defeat a nurse in hand-to-hand combat to resume her mission (giving in fact infinite lives to a skilled player).

88697.name: Krew i Rdza 2
88697.description:
User Summary:

"Krew i Rdza 2" (eng. Blood and Rust 2) is an expansion for Neuroshima. It's written for Game Masters. Book includes: scenarios, ideas for adventures. There are also a couple informations about Neuroshima world: NeoJungle, Policeoffice, Federation of Appallachs. Book offers new setting - Neuroshima 2020.

88698.name: StarLancer
88698.description:
STARLANCER combines the action of first-person space combat with the drama and intrigue of a classic air combat movie. Countries from around the world including the United States, China, Russia and Great Britain have formed strategic alliances and now battle for control of Earth, Mars and other planets across the solar system. As part of a newly formed, ragtag aviation unit, the 45th Volunteers Squadron, players must prove themselves and earn the respect of their peers.

Source: The Publisher Website.

88699.name: Mission
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88699.description:
User Summary

The secret agent Halox has gone rogue. He has stolen the Megatron bomb secret plans and intends to sell them to the highest bidder. Equipped with a combat suit and laser helmet, you must explore an abandoned factory, find Halox's hideout and destroy him.

Mission is an isometric 3d arcade game. The player must cross each of the 80 rooms while battling respawning enemies. Each room has special features, like elevating platforms or teleporters which must be used to reach the exit to the next room. The player can find better suits and helmets, giving him more energy or firepower.

88700.name: Chromium ES
88700.description:
User Summary

In Chromium, you play as the captain of the cargo ship Chromium E.S., responsible for delivering supplies to your troops on the front line. Your ship has a small fleet of robotic fighters which you control from the relative safety of the Chromium vessel.

The game plays as a classic arcade game like R-type. You keep flying ever onward, while you shoot at everything that moves, in order to destroy them before they reach your mothership.

88701.name: Tachyon: The Fringe
88701.description:
Caught in the middle of a violent conflict on the fringe of the galaxy - your ability to survive will depend on your piloting skills and combat savvy as a mercenary space fighter. But, as you explore the vastly detailed world of Tachyon: The Fringe, you will often find that the most, powerful weapon on your ship, is in your head.

Source: The Publisher Website.

88702.name: Glow Doodle Fall
88702.description:
User Summary

In Glow Doodle Fall, you play a round ball-like character, who's trying to escape the spikes from above, that are closing in at every moment. You will find different powerups that will either help you, or make your attempt to escape harder.

You just need to tilt the phone to control the character right or left to fall down through the holes and avoid getting spiked at the top. Score points by staying alive as long as possible.

88703.name: Heavy Gear
88703.description:
Heavy Gear is based on the miniatures game of the same name. Faced with the loss of the Battletech/MechWarrior property, Activision's Production Executive, Frank Evers (NYPH), spearheaded the acquisition of the video game license in 1995. The story of the first game, Heavy Gear: The New Breed, followed the crew of the CNCS landship (an enormous hovercraft carrier), 'Vigilance' as they played a cat-and-mouse game across the Badlands with a rival landship from the AST, the 'Draco'. The game was made for the Windows 95 operating system and was partly based on a game engine derived from existing MechWarrior 2: Mercenaries code.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heavy Gear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88704.name: Oudordodo
88704.description:
To find out where Dodo the little bear is sleeping, you must ask the right questions and work it out by process of elimination.

Rules of the game: Arrange all the cards, face side down, in the centre. The game is played in clockwise direction. The youngest player begins: he is the leader of the game. The other player(s) turn around while the leader hides Dodo under one of thecards. When it is their turn, the other players ask the leader a question. e.g. “Does Dodo sleep with an animal with whiskers?” The leader of the game must reply yes or no. If the reply is yes, all the animals which do not have whiskers are turned over.
If the reply is no, all the animals which have whiskers are turned over.

88705.name: 4x4 Jam
88705.description:
Race 4x4 JAM, the most unique all-terrain off-road racing game you could ever see on iPhone and iTouch - but don't take every turn seriously.
Feel free to jump over your opponent or roll down a steep hill. There are no rules and no boundaries, racing goes for pure fun.
Find yourself behind the wheels of off-road vehicles with realistic and the most enjoyable tilted or tapped game control. The realistic physics system of JAM puts a smile upon your face.

Don't look for boundaries like in other racing games, 4x4 Jam doesn't limit the area. You can really drive as far as you wish!
The game offers 100% total freedom to race across the varied terrains without any limitations.
Listen to 9 licensed rock tracks during the intense races.
Challenge your opponents on icy mountains or hot sand dunes and experience the excitement of hill climbing with custom build off-road vehicles.
You will see that reaching the gate on the top of the hills is not always so easy.

Game-modes

Jam
High-speed dash to race through a series of gates placed randomly on the terrain.
A marker constantly indicates the most direct route between the vehicle and the next gate.
Be the first to pass a gate and earn more points in more difficult modes.

Off Road Race
If you are a more traditional racing fan, Off-Road Race mode will give you high-octane excitement.
Rocks, potholes, mud holes, trees and various objects will turn your route into adventurous victory
But often the more daredevil driver will succeed over those who opt for strategy!

Road Race
Pedal to metal lap based race on the bumpy roads where you must go through a sequence of gates.
Follow the arrow to find the next gate and feel free to smash into your opponents.

Free Ride
Explore the map and put your car to the test. Ride across the terrain just for fun and learn the most enjoyable vehicle behavior on iPhone.
Set the number of AI cars with which you can explore the environment.

Source: The Developer Website.

88706.name: HyperBlade
88706.description:
HyperBlade is an action video game, depicting a futuristic sport in a futuristic world. The sport is a mutated version of Hockey, played in an egg-shaped arena rather than on a flat field or rink, which is loaded with weapons and deadly traps.

It was released by Wizbang! Software Productions in collaboration with Activision in 1996 for Windows 95, and serious graphics bugs are common in later operating systems. The game was to be released for the Sega Saturn video game console as well, but was canceled months before its release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hyperblade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

88707.name: A Doodle Fly - Fly to Mars
88707.description:
User Summary

In this game, you will control a character you designed yourself. The goal of the game is to answer the question "Is the moon rabbit real?"

In "A Doodle Fly - Fly To Mars" you customize virtually everything. You will blast yourself toward outer space with the aid of propeller beanies, springboards, rockets, planes and clouds which all help carry you to greater heights and distances.

88708.name: Ken il Guerriero: Il gioco di ruolo
rpg: Il gioco di ruolo di Ken il Guerriero
88708.description:
User Summary :
Successful Italian RPG based on the comic and cartoon hero Ken the Great Bear Fist, of the Japanese manga series Fist of the North Star.

88709.name: AR Monster
88709.description:
Search for hidden monsters all over the world using the Camera function! Traditional RPG utilizing Augmented Reality!

Search for hidden monsters from all over the world through your Camera!

AR Monster is a Role Playing Game using the Augmented Reality technology.

A monster will appear in the world taken through the camera. Search for it by pointing the view finder in various directions!

Different monsters will appear due to the use of the GPS function, so change of location means completely new monsters. There maybe monsters that appear only in certain areas!?

Tap the appeared monster to start up the battle! Attack their weak points by using the 6 types of weapons wisely.

Once the monster is defeated, they are registered in the "Book of Sealing". Thus creating your own collection of Monsters! Will you be the one to gather all 600 monsters to complete the Book of Sealing!?

Source: The Developer Website.

88710.name: Mobile Man
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
88710.description:
User Summary

Mobile Man is an arcade adventure game with ecological overtones. A nearby planet has been turned into a galactic junkyard. Mutants terrorize the population and barrels of radioactive waste cover the landscape. Armed with your trusty Mobileman, you decide to put an end to this and rid the planet of its junk.

Mobile man is a sidescrolling arcade adventure game. The player must explore tunnels and destroy mutants and barrels. Flowers can be picked up that change the color of the player's shots (mutants are only vulnerable to shots of their own color). Any contact with a monster costs a life, and there is an energy bar that needs to be periodically replenished by visiting food sources. The game also has puzzle elements like walls that can be destroyed or hidden flowers.

88711.name: Polish Campaign Pack
88711.description:
This is a 10 scenario pack for Advanced Squad Leader that covers the Polish Campaign of September and October of 1939.

The scenarios are:

FE 176 Defense of Wysloka - A German Grenadier unit is attempting to bypass a mixed unit of Polish infantry and motorized artillery.

FE 177 First Invasion of Germany - German units are trying to disengage from a Polish armored force advancing toward the German border. This scenario requires board FE1. (Not included in the pack)

FE 178 Crushing Polish Victory - A Polish mixed force must attempt to block a German armored formation from penetrating to the rear.

FE 179 Jakacking Ass - Polish infantry attempting to hold a town against a German armored formation.

FE 180 Andrzejewo Aflame - Polish infantry attempt to avoid a German pincer movement in the middle Polish campaign.

FE 181 Gardens of the Citadel - German and Polish combined forces engage in city combat.
